properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system will approach the Maritimes on Sunday with snow beginning over western New Brunswick Sunday evening. At this time there is still some uncertainty in the precise amount and location of heaviest snow but it seems likely that some areas will receive upwards of 15 cm by Monday morning. Snow will likely persist into late Monday for northeast parts of the province. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-24T05:29:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-23T13:30:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2924507863.2019
Area: Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway, Bathurst and Chaleur Region, Miramichi and area, Acadian Peninsula
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Stuartburn
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-11-24T11:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-11-23T11:46:01-06:00, CDE6C63B-45DF-B0F4-8430-521414DF20EB
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Snow is expected to develop over northern sections of Banff National Park along Highway 93 from Sunwapta Pass to the village of Lake Louise this evening. Total snowfall amounts will be 10 centimetres by Sunday morning. The townsite of Banff itself is likely to only receive 2 centimetres from this weather system. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-24T14:26:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-23T22:27:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0595475614.2019
Area: Clearwater Co. near Siffleur Wilderness Area, Banff Nat. Park near Saskatchewan River Crossing, Banff Nat. Park near Lake Louise, Banff Nat. Park near Banff
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly winds will increase further this evening. Gusts near 100 km/h are expected to end Sunday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-24T13:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-24T02:26:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0945124707.2019

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Les Suêtes winds gusting to 110 km/h are expected to develop overnight Sunday and will persist into Monday morning. ### Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.

Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-24T02:31:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2604316271.2019
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm is expected. Heavy snowfall today over Clyde River and tapering off tonight. A low pressure system is currently giving snow to Clyde River. Total snowfall amounts near 10 cm are expected by late today with the snow tapering off this evening. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-24T05:39:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-23T20:24:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1390513055.2019
Area: Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. An intense frontal system moving through BC will bring significant snow along Highway 1 from Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass. Snow will continue tonight before easing to a few flurries early Sunday morning. Total snowfall accumulations are expected to be between 20 to 25 cm by Sunday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-24T14:10:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-23T22:11:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2780465403.2019
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, ice pellets and freezing rain possible for Sunday night. Snow will begin over western New Brunswick Sunday evening ahead of a low pressure system approaching the Maritimes from the southwest. At this time, there is still some uncertainty as to the amount and location of heaviest snow, but it seems likely that some areas will receive upwards of 15 cm by Monday morning. Snow will likely persist into late Monday over northern parts of the province. Central parts of the province, possibly as far south as Fredericton, could see an extended period of freezing rain on Sunday night. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-24T18:32:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-24T02:33:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4258843895.2019
Area: Fredericton and Southern York County, Oromocto and Sunbury County, Woodstock and Carleton County, Stanley - Doaktown - Blackville Area, Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, Mount Carleton - Renous Highway, Bathurst and Chaleur Region, Miramichi and area, Acadian Peninsula
